The Buddha told Maitreya Bodhisattva:

Listen carefully, listen carefully!

I will explain it for you.

This person, thus contemplating with true mindfulness, deeply gives rise to faith and joy, and makes Buddha images based on the major and minor marks. The merit is vast and boundless, immeasurable and incalculable.

If someone uses various colored silks to paint and decorate, or melts gold, silver, copper, iron, lead, tin, and other metals, or carves sandalwood and other fragrances, or mixes with pearls, conches, shells, brocades, and woven silks, red earth, white ash, mud, wood, and other such materials, according to their ability, to make Buddha images, even as small as the size of a finger, able to make those who see them know it is a venerable countenance, the rewards for that person's merit, I will now explain.

Such a person, although still transmigrating in birth and death, will never be born in a poor family, nor will they be born in a small country on the border, a lowly family, or an orphaned family, nor will they be born as a mleccha, a merchant, a peddler, a butcher, or any such family, up to not being born in a lowly craft, an impure lineage, a non-Buddhist ascetic, or a family with wrong views;
except by the power of their vows, they will not be born in those places.
This person is always born in the family of a wheel-turning sage king with great power, or in the family of a pure-practicing brahmin, wealthy and self-sufficient, without fault.
Wherever they are born, they always encounter the buddhas, serve and make offerings to them.
Or they may become a king who upholds the true Dharma, teaches with the Dharma, and does not follow wrong paths.

Or they become wheel-turning sage kings, with the seven treasures complete, a thousand sons fully endowed, soaring through the sky, transforming the four continents, enjoying self-mastery and abundant happiness until the end of their lives.

The body he receives will be free from all ugliness. His eyes will not be blind or squinting, his ears will not be deaf or impaired, his nose will not be crooked or flat, his mouth will not be crooked or askew, his lips will not hang down, nor will they be wrinkled or rough, his teeth will not be sparse or missing, black or yellow, his tongue will not be short or constricted, his neck will not have a goiter, his body will not be hunchbacked, his complexion will not be mottled, his arms will not be short, his feet will not be lame or crippled, he will not be too thin, too fat, too tall, or too short;

Maitreya!
It is like a person who falls into a cesspool, and after getting out, scrapes off the filth, washes with clean water, anoints the body with fragrance, and puts on new clean clothes.
Compared to this person before getting out of the cesspool, how far apart are the clean and dirty smells?
This is a vast difference, with no equal or comparison.
Maitreya!
If a person in the cycle of birth and death is able to arouse faith and make a Buddha image, compared to before making it, the difference is also like this.
One should know that this person, wherever he is born, will purify karmic hindrances and understand various skills without a teacher.
Although born in the human realm, he will obtain the six sense faculties of a god;
If reborn in the heavens, they will surpass the other gods.
Wherever they are born, they will have no illnesses or suffering, no leprosy, no boils, and will not be afflicted by ghosts or spirits.

They will have no epilepsy, insanity, or other illnesses, no jaundice, malaria, tumors, or malignant sores, no hidden illnesses, no excessive vomiting or diarrhea, no indigestion, no body aches, no paralysis of half the body - they will be free from all such illnesses.
They will also not be harmed by poisons, weapons, tigers, wolves, lions, water, fire, or enemies, and will always be fearless and free from wrongdoing.
Maitreya!

If there are sentient beings who have previously created evil karma and are about to experience various kinds of suffering, such as being shackled, fettered, beaten, scolded, burned, flayed, or having their hair pulled out, being bound upside down and hung high, or even having their limbs cut off;
If one gives rise to faith and makes Buddha images, one will not experience such painful retributions.
If there are places where bandits invade, cities are destroyed, evil stars appear, famines, or epidemics, one will not be born in such places.
If it is said that one is born there, that is a false statement.
At that time, Maitreya Bodhisattva-MahÄsattva addressed the Buddha, saying:
World-Honored One!
The TathÄgata always says that good and bad karma are not lost.
If there are sentient beings who commit grave offenses and will be born in lowly and poor families, with short lifespans and much illness,
and later give rise to faith and make Buddha images, will they still experience the retribution for those offenses?
Or will they not experience it?
The Buddha told Maitreya Bodhisattva:
Maitreya!
You should listen attentively now!
I will explain it for you.

If those sentient beings, after committing offenses, repent with a repentant mind, seek forgiveness, decisively cut off [repetition], and vow not to commit them again, all their previous actions will be eliminated.
I will now explain this matter in detail for you.
Maitreya!
It is like a person who, due to stinginess in past lives, experiences the suffering of poverty, lacks wealth and treasures, and is destitute.

Suddenly encountering a bhiká¹£u who has first entered meditative absorption, upon emerging from absorption, he respectfully offers food and drink. After this person has made the offering, he forever abandons poverty and all his needs are met according to his wishes.
Maitreya!
Where is the poor person's past-life evil karma and its present retribution now?
Maitreya Bodhisattva said:
World-Honored One!
Due to the offering of food, all the evil karma from past lives is completely extinguished, forever leaving poverty behind, and one becomes greatly wealthy and fulfilled.
The Buddha said:
Maitreya!
As you have said.

You should know that this person is also like this. Because of creating the Buddha's image, all their evil karma will be completely exhausted without remainder, and they will not have to undergo the retribution they should have received.
Maitreya!
There are three kinds of karma:ğŸ”½First, that which is experienced in the present life;

Within these three kinds of karma, each has both definite and indefinite [results].
If a person with faith creates an image of the Buddha, they will only experience a small portion of the definite karma of the present life, and the rest will not be experienced.
At that time, Maitreya Bodhisattva-MahÄsattva addressed the Buddha, saying:
World-Honored One!

Or will they not fall?
The Buddha told Maitreya Bodhisattva:
Maitreya!
I will now explain a parable for you.
Suppose there is a person holding a strong bow who shoots an arrow upward through the leaves in a forest, the arrow penetrating without obstruction.

If there are sentient beings who commit these heinous offenses but later create Buddha images with sincere repentance and attain rootless faith, with a slight weakening of self-centered thoughts, although they fall into hell they will immediately escape, just like the arrow does not stop, so is this case.

It is also like a bhiká¹£u who attains the supernormal power of spiritual penetrations, going from this shore of the ocean to the other shore, roaming the four continents, with nothing able to obstruct him.

There are sentient beings who destroy the Buddha's Dharma body, who explain the Dharma as non-Dharma and non-Dharma as Dharma, but later give rise to faith and make Buddha images. Will their grave offenses also be extinguished?
Or will they not be extinguished?
The Buddha told Maitreya Bodhisattva:
Maitreya!

If those sentient beings explain the Dharma as non-Dharma and non-Dharma as Dharma, but only speak with their mouths without destroying their views, and later give rise to faith and make Buddha images, then their previous evil karma will only result in a light retribution in their present body, they will not fall into evil destinies, but they will not immediately be liberated from birth and death.
At that time, Maitreya Bodhisattva-MahÄsattva addressed the Buddha, saying:

The Buddha told Maitreya Bodhisattva:
Maitreya!
It is like a person whose body is bound by five fetters. If they attain liberation, it is like a bird leaving a net and reaching a place without obstruction.

This person is also like this. If they give rise to faith and recollect the Buddha's merits while creating Buddha images, all their karmic hindrances will be eliminated, and they will quickly escape from birth and death without obstruction.

Contemplate it well!
I will explain it to the great king in detail.
Great King!
In the past, for the sake of seeking enlightenment, I made Buddha images with various jewels, sandalwood, and colorful paintings, more numerous than the assembly of humans and devas here.
By this merit, although I was in samsara and had not yet exhausted all afflictions, the body I received was as firm as vajra, indestructible.

I recall in the past, in immeasurable eons of birth and death, I made Buddha images. Even then, I still had immeasurable afflictions such as greed and hatred, and was bound to them.

How much more so now that I have attained supreme perfect enlightenment, yet have such unfavorable circumstances?
Great King!
If I had previously made Buddha images and now have residual karma resulting in this retribution, how can I speak fearlessly, saying that making Buddha images can definitely exhaust all evil karma?
Great King!
I have given immeasurable food, drink, wealth, and jewels in the past. Why then do I not obtain alms now and eat horse oats?

I manifest such various afflictions in the world in order to show beings that karmic retribution is not lost, to cause them to give rise to fear, to abandon all evil, to cultivate wholesome practices, and then to understand that the eternal body, the Dharma body, has limitless lifespan and pure lands.

The buddhas, the tathÄgatas, are without falsehood. With great compassion and skillful wisdom, they are able to manifest in various ways like this.
When King Prasenajit heard this, he rejoiced and leaped for joy. Together with countless hundreds of thousands of beings, they all gave rise to the mind of supreme, perfect enlightenment.
At that time, Maitreya Bodhisattva MahÄsattva addressed the Buddha, saying:
World-Honored One!

There are women whose intentions are narrow and small, who harbor much jealousy and anger, who are frivolous, deceitful, unforgiving, and ungrateful. Even if they seek enlightenment, they cannot firmly uphold it, and always wish to deceive all beings, and are also deceived by others.
World-Honored One!
If these women create Buddha images, will such karmic actions be eliminated?
In the future, will they become courageous and capable men, seeking the fruit of Buddhahood?
Will they become people who know gratitude and repay kindness?
Will they possess wisdom, great kindness, and great compassion?
Will they be able to become disgusted with the Dharma of birth and death?

The Buddha told Maitreya Bodhisattva:
Maitreya!
If a woman is able to create a Buddha image, she will never again receive a woman's body.
If she accepts the body, she will become a precious woman, the most honored and supreme.
However, there are five kinds of virtues that women possess, which surpass those of other women.
What are the five?
First, giving birth to children;
Second, a noble and distinguished family;
Third, a virtuous and chaste nature;
Fourth, a unique and outstanding appearance;
Fifth, a beautiful and proper countenance.
Maitreya!
All women have eight kinds of causes and conditions that always result in a female body.
What are the eight?
First, loving and favoring the female body;
Second, being greedy for female desires;
Third, always praising the appearance and features of women with the mouth;
Fourth, the mind is not upright, and one hides one's actions;
Fifth, despising one's own husband;
Sixth, cherishing others deeply;
Seventh, knowing that others have kindness but turning one's back on them;
Eighth, falsely adorning oneself, wishing to deceive others.
If one can permanently sever these eight things and create a Buddha image, until one attains Buddhahood one will always be a man, and it is impossible to receive a woman's body again.
Maitreya!
There are four kinds of causes and conditions that cause men to receive a woman's body.
What are the four?
First, calling the Buddha and all Bodhisattvas and sages with a woman's voice in a frivolous manner;
Second, with a slanderous mind, saying that those who uphold pure precepts have violated the precepts;
Third, delighting in flattery and deception;
Fourth, seeing others surpass oneself, giving rise to jealousy.
If a man practices these four things, after his life ends he will definitely receive a woman's body and undergo the suffering of the evil paths for immeasurable kalpas.

If one deeply generates faith and repents of one's past actions, and creates a Buddha image, then all one's offenses will be extinguished, and one will definitely no longer receive the retribution of being a woman.
Maitreya!
There are four kinds of causes and conditions that cause men to receive the body of a eunuch.
What are the four?
First, harming the form of others, even down to animals;
Second, being angry and laughing at, and slandering, the precepts of monks;
Third, having many desires, and thus intentionally violating the precepts;
Fourth, being intimate with those who violate the precepts, and further encouraging others to violate them.

If there are men who first engage in these things, and later generate faith and create Buddha images, they will not receive this retribution until they become Buddhas, and will always be men with complete faculties.
Maitreya!
There are four kinds of karma that can cause men to receive the body of a hermaphrodite, the lowest among all people.
What are the four?
First, having impure thoughts towards those who should be respected;
Second, being attached to men in inappropriate ways;
Third, engaging in sexual activity with oneself;
Fourth, using one's own body to seduce others.

If there are sentient beings who have done these things and deeply regret and repent of their past mistakes, arouse pure faith, create Buddha images, and so forth, they will not receive this kind of body even up to becoming Buddhas.
Maitreya!
There are four conditions that cause men to always give rise to women's love and desire, and enjoy others acting as husbands towards them.
What are the four?
First, either out of resentment or playfulness, slandering and defaming others;
Second, enjoying wearing women's clothing and ornaments;
Third, engaging in sexual activity with one's own relatives;
Fourth, falsely accepting others' respect without having any superior virtues.
Because of these causes and conditions, it causes men to give rise to such deviant afflictions.
If one regrets past transgressions, does not create new ones, and gives rise to faith and joy, making Buddha images, then one's offenses will be extinguished and this mind will also cease.
Maitreya!
There are five kinds of stinginess that can destroy sentient beings.
What are the five?
First, being stingy with the neighboring villages where one resides, one will be born in the wilderness;
Second, being stingy with the houses one lives in, one will become a ghost dwelling in filth;
Third, being stingy with one's own fine appearance, one will be born ugly and disagreeable;
Fourth, being stingy with one's possessions, one will be born poor and lacking in clothing and food;
Fifth, being stingy with the Dharma one knows, one will be born as an animal with dull faculties.
If one regrets one's past karma and creates a revered Buddha image, then one will forever part with a stingy mind and not experience the above consequences.
Maitreya!
There are also five conditions that cause sentient beings to be born in border regions or places without the Buddha's teachings.
What are the five?
First, not giving rise to pure faith in the good field of the Three Jewels;
Second, turning one's back on reality and violating principle, falsely practicing precepts;
Third, not teaching in accordance with principle and reality;
Fourth, destroying the harmonious Sangha and causing it to split into two factions;
Fifth, at the very least, causing a split between two monks and preventing them from being in harmony.
If one permanently cuts off these karmic actions and makes Buddha images, one will always encounter the appearance of Buddhas and constantly hear the essential teachings.
Maitreya!
Sentient beings also have five kinds of causes and conditions that always lead to being disliked and chased away by people, even by their closest relatives who do not wish to see them.
What are the five?ğŸ”½First, divisive speech;
Second, harsh speech;ğŸ”½Third, being argumentative;
Fourth, being angry a lot;
Fifth, skillfully speaking similar words to slander.

Later, if one generates the intention to create a Buddha image and repents past evil karma, vowing not to commit them again, the created offenses will all be eliminated, and one will be loved and respected by all people.
Why is this so?

Because the Buddhas possess immeasurable and boundless supreme blessings and virtues, immeasurable and boundless great wisdom, and immeasurable and boundless various rare and wonderful merits and virtues such as samÄdhi and liberation.

Suppose someone were to reduce the lands of the trichiliocosm to dust motes, and further crush those dust motes, with each dust mote equal to the number of dust motes in the lands of the trichiliocosm. There would be as many lands of the trichiliocosm as there are such crushed dust motes.

Suppose there is a person who, with the power of spiritual penetrations, takes a single tiny particle and goes to the east, passing through as many trichiliocosms in a single instant as there are particles in that tiny particle. The second, third, and subsequent instants are all like this, continuing until the end of as many eons as those particles. In each instant of those eons, taking each instant as an eon, passing through as many trichiliocosms as there are particles in that tiny particle.

After completing this, he then puts down that particle. This person returns and takes another particle, going to the east again, passing through twice as many as before, putting down the particle and returning, to the third particle, twice as many as the second.
In this way, the number increases progressively, continuing until the end of the number of particles.
As it is said for the east, so it is also for the south, west, and north.
Wherever this person goes in the four directions, all the lands are reduced to dust.
All these subtle dust motes can be counted and measured by all sentient beings together,
but the merit contained in a single pore of the TathÄgata's body cannot be known.

Because the merit possessed by the Buddhas, the TathÄgatas, is immeasurable and inconceivable.

Therefore, if one has a pure and faithful mind and creates an image of the Buddha, all karmic hindrances will be eliminated without exception, and the merit one will obtain will be immeasurable and boundless, and one will ultimately attain supreme perfect enlightenment, forever liberating sentient beings from all suffering and distress.

After the Buddha spoke this sutra, Maitreya Bodhisattva, the Thirty-three Celestials, King Udayana, and all the worldly gods, humans, asuras, gandharvas, and others, having heard what the Buddha said, all greatly rejoiced, believed and received it, and practiced it with respect.
